  • Exports
Source   Edit  

Data model. Contains common data types used throughout the library.

Imports

common, notes, private/data, private/utils, version

Types

Effect {.packed.} = object
  cmd*: uint8
  param*: uint8
Effect column. An effect has a type and a parameter.
  • cmd: Effect command, should be in range of the EffectCmd enum, unknown commands are to be ignored.
  • param: Effect parameter byte, only needed for certain effects.
Source   Edit   
EffectCmd = enum
  ecNoEffect = 0,           ## No effect, this effect column is unset.
  ecPatternGoto,            ## Bxx begin playing given pattern immediately
  ecPatternHalt,            ## C00 stop playing
  ecPatternSkip,            ## D00 begin playing next pattern immediately
  ecSetTempo,               ## Fxx set the tempo
  ecSfx,                    ## Txx play sound effect
  ecSetEnvelope,            ## Exx set the persistent envelope/wave id setting
  ecSetTimbre,              ## Vxx set persistent duty/wave volume setting
  ecSetPanning,             ## Ixy set channel panning setting
  ecSetSweep,               ## Hxx set the persistent sweep setting (CH1 only)
  ecDelayedCut,             ## Sxx note cut delayed by xx frames
  ecDelayedNote,            ## Gxx note trigger delayed by xx frames
  ecLock,                   ## L00 (lock) stop the sound effect on the current channel
  ecArpeggio,               ## 0xy arpeggio with semi tones x and y
  ecPitchUp,                ## 1xx pitch slide up
  ecPitchDown,              ## 2xx pitch slide down
  ecAutoPortamento,         ## 3xx automatic portamento
  ecVibrato,                ## 4xy vibrato
  ecVibratoDelay,           ## 5xx delay vibrato xx frames on note trigger
  ecTuning,                 ## Pxx fine tuning
  ecNoteSlideUp,            ## Qxy note slide up
  ecNoteSlideDown,          ## Rxy note slide down
  ecSetGlobalVolume          ## Jxy set global volume scale
Enumeration for all available effects. Source   Edit   
EffectCounts = array[ChannelId, uint8]
Array containing an amount for each channel, that determines how many effect columns should be shown to the user. Source   Edit   
InfoString = array[32, char]
Fixed-length string of 32 characters, used for artist information. Source   Edit   
Instrument = object
  name*: string
  channel*: ChannelId
  sequences*: array[SequenceKind, Sequence]
Container for a Trackerboy instrument. An instrument provides frame level control of a channel's parameters and is activated on each note trigger.
  • name: Optional name of the instrument.
  • channel: The channel to preview this instrument on. Note that instruments can be used on any channel, so this field is purely informational.
  • sequences: A Sequence for each SequenceKind.
Source   Edit   
InstrumentColumn = distinct Column
Column in a TrackRow that contains an optional instrument to use. Source   Edit   
InstrumentTable = Table[Instrument]
Container for Instrument. Up to 64 Instruments can be stored in this table and is addressable via a TableId. Source   Edit   
LoopPoint = object
  enabled*: bool
  index*: uint8
Object that indicates a loop index in a sequence. If enabled, the sequence will loop to the specified index.
  • enabled: determines if the sequence will loop
  • index: the index to loop back to
Source   Edit   
Module = object
  songs*: SongList
  instruments*: InstrumentTable
  waveforms*: WaveformTable
  title*, artist*, copyright*: InfoString
  comments*: string
  tickrate*: Tickrate
  private*: ModulePrivate
A module is a container for songs, instruments and waveforms. Each module can store up to 256 songs, 64 instruments and 64 waveforms. Instruments and Waveforms are shared between all songs.
  • songs: The list of all songs in this module.
  • instruments: The module's instrument table, shared with all songs.
  • waveforms: The module's waveform table, shared with all songs.
  • title: Optional title information for the module.
  • artist: Optional artist information for the module.
  • copyright: Optional copyright information for the module.
  • comments: Addition comment information about the module.
  • tickrate: The Tickrate used by all songs in the module.
Source   Edit   
ModulePiece = Instrument | Song | Waveform
Type class for an individual component of a module. Source   Edit   
NoteColumn = distinct Column
Column in a TrackRow that contains the an optional note value. Source   Edit   
Order = seq[OrderRow]
An Order is a sequence of OrderRows, that determine the layout of a Song. Each Order must have at least 1 row and have no more than 256 rows. Source   Edit   
OrderLen = range[1 .. 256]
Subrange of valid lengths, or number of order rows, for an Order. Source   Edit   
OrderRow = array[ChannelId, TrackId]
An OrderRow is a set of TrackIds, one for each channel. Source   Edit   
Pattern = array[ChannelId, Track]
A pattern is a composition of multiple Tracks, one for each channel. Patterns are mutable. For immutable patterns use PatternView. Source   Edit   
PatternRow = array[ChannelId, TrackRow]
A full row in a pattern is a TrackRow for each track/channel. Source   Edit   
PatternView = array[ChannelId, TrackView]
View-only version of Pattern. Source   Edit   
Sequence = object
  loop*: LoopPoint
  data*: seq[uint8]
A sequence is a sequence of parameter changes with looping capability. (Not to be confused with a Nim sequence, seq[T]).
  • loop: The sequence's loop point.
  • data: The sequence's data, a list of bytes.
Source   Edit   
SequenceKind = enum
  skArp,                    ## Channel note or arpeggio sequence
  skPanning,                ## Channel panning
  skPitch,                  ## Channel frequency or pitch
  skTimbre,                 ## Channel timbre
  skEnvelope                 ## Channel envelope
Enumeration for the kinds of parameters a sequence can operate on. An Instrument has a Sequence for each one of these kinds. Source   Edit   
SequenceLen = range[0 .. 255]
Range of valid lengths for a Sequence's data. Source   Edit   
SomeData = Instrument | Waveform
Type class for data stored in a module data table. Source   Edit   
SomePattern = Pattern | PatternView
Type class for all pattern types. Source   Edit   
SomeTable = InstrumentTable | WaveformTable
Type class for a module data table. Source   Edit   
SomeTrack = Track | TrackView
Type class of all track types Source   Edit   
Song = object
  name*: string
  rowsPerBeat* = 4
  rowsPerMeasure* = 16
  speed* = 96'u
  effectCounts*: EffectCounts = [2'u8, 2, 2, 2]
  order*: Order
  tickrate*: Option[Tickrate]
A Song is a collection of Tracks and an Order in which they are played out.
  • name: Optional name of the song.
  • rowsPerBeat: Number of rows that make up a beat. Used for tempo calculation and by the front end for row highlights.
  • rowsPerMeasure: Number of rows that make up a measure. Informational field used by the front end for row highlights.
  • speed: Starting speed of the song.
  • effectCounts: Effect columns visible counts. Used by the front end for the number of effect columns shown for each channel.
  • order: The playback order of the song.
  • trackLen: The number of rows each track in the song is.
  • tickrate: Tickrate override for this song. If not set, then the module's tickrate should be used instead.
Source   Edit   
SongList = object
Container for songs. Songs stored in this container are references, like InstrumentTable and WaveformTable. A valid SongList contains 1-256 songs. Source   Edit   
SongPos = object
  pattern*: int
  row*: int
Song position. This object contains a position in a song.
  • pattern - The index in the song's order of the pattern.
  • row - The index of the row to start at.
Source   Edit   
SongSpan = object
  pos*: SongPos
  rows*: int
References a span in a song, or a range of rows within a pattern in a song.
  • pos - The starting position of the span.
  • rows - The amount of rows from pos included in the span.
Source   Edit   
Speed = distinct uint8
Value that indicates the playback speed of a Song. This value is in units of ticks per row, and is in fixed-point format Q4.4. Source   Edit   
System = enum
  systemDmg,                ## DMG/CGB system, 59.7 Hz
  systemSgb,                ## SGB system, 61.1 Hz
  systemCustom               ## Custom tick rate
Enumeration for types of systems the module is for. The system determines the vblank interval, or tick rate, of the engine. Source   Edit   
TableId = range[0'u8 .. (64'u8 - 1)]
Integer ID type for items in an InstrumentTable or WaveformTable. Source   Edit   
Tickrate = object
  system*: System = systemDmg
  customFramerate*: float32 = 30.0
Defines the tickrate, or interval in which a single tick or step of a song when playing back.
  • system: Specifies a predefined system's tick rate
  • customFramerate: Custom tick rate to use for systemCustom.
Source   Edit   
Track = object

Pattern data for a single track. A track stores a fixed number of rows. The data is stored using ref semantics, so assigning a track from another track will result in a shallow copy. Use the clone proc to deep copy a track if needed. A Track is invalid if it was default initialized, or if its internal data ref is nil. Use isValid() to check for validity.

Regarding mutability, all Track objects are mutable. If you need immutable access, use TrackView. A Track can be converted to a TrackView at no cost, but the opposite is not true. Converting a TrackView to a Track will result in a deep copy of the TrackView's data being made.

Source   Edit   
TrackId = uint8
Integer ID type that refers a Track in an OrderRow. Source   Edit   
TrackLen = range[1 .. 256]
Subrange of valid lengths, or number of track rows, for a Track. Source   Edit   
TrackRow {.packed.} = object
  note*: NoteColumn
  instrument*: InstrumentColumn
  effects*: array[3, Effect]
A single row of data in a Track. Guaranteed to be 8 bytes.
  • note: The note column, specifies an optional note value.
  • instrument: The instrument column, specifies which instrument to use.
  • effects: 3 available Effect columns.
Source   Edit   
TrackView = distinct Track
Same as Track, but only provides immutable access to the track data. Mutable access can be acquired by converting the view to a Track via the initTrack overload, while making a deep copy of the data. Source   Edit   
WaveData = array[16, uint8]
Waveform data. A waveform consists of 16 bytes, with each byte containing 2 4-bit PCM samples. The first sample is the upper nibble of the byte, with the second being the lower nibble. Source   Edit   
Waveform = object
  name*: string
  data*: WaveData
Container for a waveform to use on CH3.
  • name: An optional name for the waveform.
  • data: The waveform's data.
Source   Edit   
WaveformTable = Table[Waveform]
Container for Waveform. Up to 64 Waveforms can be stored in this table and is addressable via a TableId. Source   Edit  

Consts

defaultRpb = 4
Default rowsPerBeat setting for new Songs. Source   Edit   
defaultRpm = 16
Default rowsPerMeasure setting for new Songs. Source   Edit   
defaultSpeed = 96'u
Default speed setting for new Songs. Source   Edit   
defaultTickrate = (system: systemDmg, customFramerate: 30.0)
Default tickrate setting for a Module. Source   Edit   
defaultTrackLen = 64
Default trackLen setting for new Songs. Source   Edit   
effectCharMap: array[EffectCmd, char] = ['?', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'F', 'T', 'E', 'V',
    'I', 'H', 'S', 'G', 'L', '0', '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', 'P', 'Q', 'R', 'J']
Array that maps an EffectCmd to a char. Each effect is represented by a letter or number as its type when displayed in a tracker. Source   Edit   
effectNone = (cmd: 0'u, param: 0'u)
Effect column value for an unset effect. Same as default(Effect). Source   Edit   
instrumentNone = 0'u
Instrument column value for an unset column. Same as default(InstrumentColumn). Source   Edit   
noLoopPoint = (enabled: false, index: 0'u)
Indicates that a sequence ends at the last value, or does not loop. Source   Edit   
noteNone = 0'u
Note column value for an unset column. Same as default(NoteColumn). Source   Edit   
rangeSpeed = (a: 16'u, b: 240'u)
Valid range of Speed values. Source   Edit   
unitSpeed = 16'u
Unit speed, or a Speed that is 1.0 ticks per row. Source   Edit

Stringify an instrument column. Source   Edit

func `$`(s: Song): string {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Stringify a song for debug purposes. Source   Edit   
func `$`(s: Speed): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Stringify a Speed. The string returned is the speed's value in hexadecimal prefixed with '$'. Since the value is in Q4.4 format, the first hex is the integral part and the second is the fractional part. Source   Edit   
func `$`(span: SongSpan): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Stringify a span, formatted as pattern:row+rows Source   Edit   
func `<`(x, y: Speed): bool {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
func `<=`(x, y: Speed): bool {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
func `==`(a, b: Instrument): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Determine if two instruments are functionally equivalent. Informational data of the instruments are not tested. Source   Edit   
func `==`(a, b: SomeTable): bool
Equality test for two tables. Uses deep equality checking. Source   Edit   
func `==`(a, b: Song): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Equality test two Songs. Source   Edit   
func `==`(a, b: Waveform): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Determines if two waveforms are functionally equivalent, or if they have the same wave data. Source   Edit   
func `==`(x, y: InstrumentColumn): bool {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Test if two instrument columns are equivalent. Source   Edit   
func `==`(x, y: NoteColumn): bool {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Test if two note columns are equivalent. Source   Edit   
func `==`(x, y: SongList): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Equality test for SongList. Each song in both lists are checked for deep equality. Source   Edit   
func `==`(x, y: Speed): bool {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
func `==`(x, y: Track): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Equality test two Tracks. The tracks are equal if they have same len and data. Source   Edit   
func `==`(x, y: TrackView): bool {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
proc `=copy`(dest: var TrackMap; src: TrackMap) {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
func `[]`(s: Sequence; i: ByteIndex): uint8 {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Gets the ith element in the sequence. Same as s.data[i] Source   Edit   
func `[]`(t: Track; i: ByteIndex): TrackRow {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Gets the ith row in the track. If the track is invalid an empty row is returned. Source   Edit   
func `[]`(t: TrackView; i: ByteIndex): TrackRow {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
func `[]`(t: var Track; i: ByteIndex): var TrackRow {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}

Gets the ith row in the track, allowing mutations.

The track must be valid or an AssertDefect will be raised.

Source   Edit   
func `[]`[T: SomeData](t: Table[T]; id: TableId): iref[T]
Gets an immutable ref of the item with the given id or nil if there is no item with that id. Source   Edit   
func `[]`[T: SomeData](t: var Table[T]; id: TableId): ref T
Source   Edit   
proc `[]=`(s: var Sequence; i: ByteIndex; val: uint8) {.inline, ...raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Sets the ith element in the sequence to the given val. Same as s.data[i] = val. Source   Edit   
proc `[]=`(t: var Track; i: ByteIndex; v: TrackRow) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}

Replaces the ith row in the track with the given one.

The track must be valid or an AssertDefect will be raised.

Source   Edit   
proc add[T: SomeData](t: var Table[T]): TableId
Adds a new item to the table using the next available id. If the table is at capacity, an AssertionDefect will be raised. Source   Edit

Creates an new Module. The returned module has:
  • 1 empty song
  • an empty instrument and waveform table
  • empty comments and artist information
  • tickrate set to defaultTickrate (59.7 Hz)
  • version information with the current application version and file revision.

func uniqueIds[T: SomeData](t: Table[T]): set[TableId]
Gets a set of Ids that refer to unique data. This proc can be used to deduplicate the table's data when exporting the module. The Id chosen in the result for any set of duplicates encountered is the lowest one in the set. Ie, a Table with data set for Ids 0, 1 and 2 with equivalent data, has a uniqueIds set of { 0.TableId }. Source   Edit

Templates

template `[]`(l: SongList; i: ByteIndex): iref[Song]
Sugar for l.get(i). Source   Edit   
template editPattern(s: var Song; orderNo: ByteIndex; patternVar, body: untyped)
Edits an entire pattern in place for the given orderNo or index in the song order. patternVar is the name of the Pattern variable that is accessible in body.

Example:

var song = initSong()
# edit the first pattern such that:
#  - the first row in ch1's track has the note set to D#2
#  - the first row in ch2's track has effect#2 set to etTuning with a param of 0x82
song.editPattern(0, pattern):
  pattern[ch1][0].note = noteColumn(3)
  pattern[ch2][0].effects[1] = initEffect(ecTuning, 0x82)
song.viewPattern(0, pattern):
  doAssert pattern[ch1][0].note == noteColumn(3)
  doAssert pattern[ch2][0].effects[1] == initEffect(ecTuning, 0x82)
Source   Edit   
template editTrack(s: var Song; ch: ChannelId; trackId: TrackId;
                   trackVar, body: untyped)
Edit a channel's track in place via its track id. trackVar is the name of the variable that contains the requested track that is accessible in body.

Example:

var song = initSong()
song.editTrack(ch3, 0, track):
  track[1].note = noteColumn(10)
  track[4].instrument = instrumentColumn(0)
song.viewTrack(ch3, 0, track):
  doAssert track[1].note == noteColumn(10)
  doAssert track[4].instrument == instrumentColumn(0)
Source   Edit   
template orow(id1 = 0'u8; id2 = 0'u8; id3 = 0'u8; id4 = 0'u8): OrderRow
Sugar for initOrderRow Source   Edit   
template trow(note = noteNone; instrument = instrumentNone; e1 = effectNone;
              e2 = effectNone; e3 = effectNone): TrackRow
Sugar for initTrackRow Source   Edit   
template viewPattern(s: Song; orderNo: ByteIndex; patternVar, body: untyped)

Similar to editPattern, but instead only provides read-only access to all tracks in the pattern, by using a PatternView. patternVar is the name of the PatternView variable that is accessible in body.

Same as viewTrack if any track in the pattern does not exist, an invalid one will take its place.

See the example in editPattern for example usage.

Source   Edit   
template viewTrack(s: Song; ch: ChannelId; trackId: TrackId;
                   trackVar, body: untyped)

Similar to editTrack, but instead only provides read-only access to a track, in place. trackVar is the name of the variable that contains a TrackView of the requested track that is accessible in body.

If the track does not exist, then value will refer to an invalid track, or a track with 0 rows.

See the example in editTrack for example usage.

Source   Edit
